com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.linearrealarithmetic

Class LinearRealArithmeticUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.theory.linearrealarithmetic.LinearRealArithmeticUtil

  • @Beta
public class LinearRealArithmeticUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of methods for manipulating linear real arithmetic literals.
    Author:
    braz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinearRealArithmeticUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Expression isolateVariable(Expression variable, Expression numericalComparison)
      Returns an expression equivalent to linear arithmetic expression numericalComparison in which terms are cancelled out, numerical constants are summed together, and the given variable occurs alone in one of the sides.
      static Expression simplify(Expression expression)
      Simplify a linear real arithmetic literal.
      static Expression simplify(Expression expression, Expression variable)
      Simplify a literal with respect to a variable by isolating it.
      static Expression simplify(Expression expression, LinearRealArithmeticTheory theory, Context context)
      Simplify a linear real arithmetic literal using #simplify(Expression, Symbol) with respect to the first variable found in the expression (variable is determined in accordance to Theory.isVariable(Expression, Context); the same expression is returned if there are no liner real arithmetic variable.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • simplify

        public static Expression simplify(Expression expression,
                                  LinearRealArithmeticTheory theory,
                                  Context context)
        Simplify a linear real arithmetic literal using #simplify(Expression, Symbol) with respect to the first variable found in the expression (variable is determined in accordance to Theory.isVariable(Expression, Context); the same expression is returned if there are no liner real arithmetic variable.

      • simplify

        public static Expression simplify(Expression expression,
                                  Expression variable)
                           throws java.lang.Error
        Simplify a literal with respect to a variable by isolating it. If the variable is not present, all terms are move to the right-hand side.
        Parameters:
        expression -
        variable -
        Returns:
        Throws:

      • isolateVariable

        public static Expression isolateVariable(Expression variable,
                                         Expression numericalComparison)
                                  throws java.lang.Error
        Returns an expression equivalent to linear arithmetic expression numericalComparison in which terms are cancelled out, numerical constants are summed together, and the given variable occurs alone in one of the sides.
